Class DirectedGraph<K,E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • DirectedGraph<K,E>

  • public class DirectedGraph<K,E>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as a directed graph which will store a collection of directed edges.
    Author:
    Craig Lombardo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DirectedGraph(K k, E e)
      This constructor method creates a directed graph with a single key/element node.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      This method adds an edge from the node with key k1 to the node with key k2.
      boolean addNode(K k, E e)
      This method adds a new node to the graph.
      boolean checkAllConnected()
      This method returns whether or not all nodes can be reached in the graph.
      java.util.ArrayList<DirectedGraph.DirectedGraphNode> findShortestPath(K k1, K k2)
      This method finds the shortest path from the node with key k1 to the node with key k2.
      java.lang.String findShortestPathInfo(K k1, K k2)
      This method finds the shortest path information from the node with key k1 to the node with key k2.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main method is used in conjunction with the graph presented to

    • Constructor Detail

      • DirectedGraph

        public DirectedGraph(K k,
                     E e)
        This constructor method creates a directed graph with a single key/element node.
        Parameters:
        k - The key of the first node.
        e - The element of the first node.

    • Method Detail

      • addNode

        public boolean addNode(K k,
                       E e)
        This method adds a new node to the graph.
        Parameters:
        k - The key of the new node.
        e - The element of new node.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if not

      • addEdge

        public boolean addEdge(K k1,
                       K k2,
                       int w)
        This method adds an edge from the node with key k1 to the node with key k2. Since it is a directed graph, k1 "points" to k2 but not in reverse.
        Parameters:
        k1 - The key of the starting node.
        k2 - The key of the destination node.
        w - The weight of the new edge.
        Returns:
        true if the edge is successfully added, false if not.

      • findShortestPath

        public java.util.ArrayList<DirectedGraph.DirectedGraphNode> findShortestPath(K k1,
                                                                             K k2)
        This method finds the shortest path from the node with key k1 to the node with key k2.
        Parameters:
        k1 - The key of the starting node.
        k2 - The key of the destination node.
        Returns:
        ArrayList An ArrayList of the path from k1 to k2

      • findShortestPathInfo

        public java.lang.String findShortestPathInfo(K k1,
                                             K k2)
        This method finds the shortest path information from the node with key k1 to the node with key k2.
        Parameters:
        k1 - The key of the starting node.
        k2 - The key of the destination node.
        Returns:
        String The information on the path from k1 to k2; information includes distance and the element of each node in the order of the path.

      • checkAllConnected

        public boolean checkAllConnected()
        This method returns whether or not all nodes can be reached in the graph.
        Returns:
        true if all can be reached, false if not

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method is used in conjunction with the graph presented to
        Parameters:
        args - This is not used in testing.
